org.opends.server.protocols.asn1

Interface ASN1Writer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable

    public interface ASN1Writer
extends java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    An interface for encoding ASN.1 elements to a data source.

    Methods for creating ASN1Writers are provided in the ASN1 class.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Closes this ASN.1 writer, flushing it first.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this ASN.1 writer, flushing it first. Closing a previously closed ASN.1 writer has no effect. Any unfinished sequences and/or sets will be ended.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while closing the writer.

      • flush

        void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Flushes the writer. If the writer has saved any elements from the previous write methods in a buffer, write them immediately to their intended destination. Then, if that destination is another byte stream, flush it. Thus one flush() invocation will flush all the buffers in a chain of streams.

        If the intended destination of this stream is an abstraction provided by the underlying operating system, for example a file, then flushing the stream guarantees only that bytes previously written to the stream are passed to the operating system for writing; it does not guarantee that they are actually written to a physical device such as a disk drive.

        Specified by:
        flush in interface java.io.Flushable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • writeBoolean

        ASN1Writer writeBoolean(boolean booleanValue)
                        throws java.io.IOException

      • writeStartSequence

        ASN1Writer writeStartSequence()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a sequence element using the Universal Sequence ASN.1 type tag. All further writes will be part of this set until writeEndSequence() is called.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while writing.

      • writeStartSequence

                              throws java.io.IOException
